contextId.information: The abstract nouns "wisdom" and "skill" can be translated using the adjectives "wise" and "skillful." AT: "You have become wealthy by your own wisdom and skill" or "You have become wealthy by being wise and skillful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: You have made yourself wealthy with wisdom and skill

contextId.information: The word "myself" adds emphasis. God would do this because the shepherds were not doing it right. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
